title: The indefinite banning of Tyler1
body:
Hey all, 

Instant Feedback catches the most unsportsmanlike players in League, but some people go out of their way to continue ruining games for the community. Because of a well-documented history of account bans for verbal abuse, intentional feeding, as well as account sharing/purchasing, evasion of sportsmanship systems, and player harassment, we will not allow Tyler1 to hold a League of Legends account, indefinitely. Any account definitively used by him will be banned immediately upon identification. 

We know we’re not perfect, and this dragged on too long, but we want you to know when the rare player comes along who’s a genuine jerk, we’ve still got your back.

This is one of the worst decisions "Riot" as a company has made in a very long time.

Tyler1 is just a normal League of Legends player. Everybody does what he does every now and then, but due to his increasing popularity among twitch viewers, "Riot" decides to ban him because of their image. 

Why now? Why does he get a ban now? He also gets trollers in his game but why ban specifically him?
This is not Tyler1's fault. 
He tried his best to ignore and mute the trollers even though he gets a constant amount of trollers in his game. 
He leveled up his account on stream without any hesitations nor obstinacy. 
In those days that he was streaming, he actually showed promise.
He gets constant hate from other pro players / streamers but tells his viewers to avoid posting about it on social media. He avoided drama.

Riot doesn't got our backs, they just think of their own personal interests. 
If you think Tyler1 is the worst player, you haven't seen shit. Streamers like Kaceytron and Nicktron are still playing on the rift without punishments. They are doing the same thing. To be honest, they are worse than Tyler1. They mock League of Legends as a whole and treat it like shit. They don't even play the game, they use half of their time reading dumb donations. 
Tyler1 has passion and actually plays the game with high skill, not like them who stands in base, reading donations while their whole team is defending inhibitors.

All things considered, some people will think differently about this, leap to conclusions and see it as "Justice" or say that he's a troll but this  is the wrong solution to the problem. In my own personal opinion, with all due respect to Riot Games, this one-sided decision is unjustifiable and misjudged.
